74D99315614B42249AF6B217BEBF06F7.description: Investigate the trade qualifier pathway as an alternate pathway to certification in a non-compulsory trade in Saskatchewan.

5B4E4C676D74459EAEBA5FCE23589661.description: Differentiate between compulsory (i.e., construction electrician, plumber, refrigeration and air conditioning mechanic, sheet metal worker and sprinkler fitter) and non-compulsory trades in Saskatchewan.

2249B4BE8D2D441BB1B135C3AD3A8DC5.description: Explore opportunities and programs that address the issue of underrepresented populations in the trades.

44C266AB1BA44855B366288E1D23C070.description: Discuss requirements and opportunities for apprentices and journeypersons to train and work in other jurisdictions.

4216713EDDC7402AB8554F2B6F7F82F7.description: Research the qualifications needed to obtain Red Seal and Blue Seal certifications.

2AAAF6D6E1794A4C977FDB32FA47FFBE.description: Use appropriate trade-related terminology including: apprentice, journeyperson, indenture, pre-employment training, designated trade and sub-trade; and, advanced standing.

C707658A9AE54203A33FCA422A7077A8.description: Investigate the apprenticeship process in a trade of personal interest.

D6933037294C45F191BE0B73F4012687.description: Investigate available programs and opportunities such as the Saskatchewan Youth Apprenticeship program and secondary apprenticeship credits that support transitions from high school.

31FEEBF3D9424F0F93608C6373D6F4D7.description: Discuss the relationship between the trades and national, provincial and territorial certification bodies including the Saskatchewan Apprenticeship and Trade Certification Commission.

21C5768D9A564C20952DCF5D1E2AACBB.description: Describe qualities of a successful apprentice.

452D1AE22B7C451390C7265873632871.description: Explore the advantages and disadvantages of apprenticeship for the individual and the trade.

C12109C857074B60A69A5A26C2EE44C5.description: Research the history and the role of apprenticeship in the trades.

D8912FC05EA14454AB634C6048EFB638.description: Outline an entry level business plan that may include start-up costs, location, customer base, advertising and an exit plan.

571FC7B2D05243AC965BC1E99B3CCC8E.description: Explain the responsibility of a business owner to employ individuals with various levels of training (e.g., apprentice, Red Seal or non-certified) and to provide quality customer service.

76868A79367F4928994812551F274642.description: Explain the advantages of and requirements for obtaining Blue Seal certification.

7CB0FF32471A41568E1114191DA1FD30.description: Research the importance of sustainable business practices such as providing quality customer service, following environmental guidelines and employing qualified and certified personnel.

35397823D6FF403BB32941F16B200B89.description: Research the requirements (e.g., registering business name, collecting and remitting taxes, licensing, zoning) for establishing a business in one’s community.

38AA74195B0A40E0A5E8DD46E55C3D9D.description: Explore the role of franchises as a business ownership model in the autobody industry.

8989ADFB0AD0454095071C7E8F16CE95.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of different business ownership models, including sole proprietorship, partnership and private corporations.

30F82D5D212E4545895C9AF4BCCA24DF.description: Explore autobody-related business opportunities in other sectors such as agriculture, leisure or heavy machinery.

DB08411564C34053A50E25EB088BD859.description: Research the evolution of the business of autobody repair from various eras and advancements in operating an autobody business.

7B58156B65864A279D1C2779600D4B3C.description: Investigate business opportunities in the autobody industry.

ECAA3B25230C4AE19D165E5D5CAAB88C.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

DC615493723A4BA38DB8083C0F5CF1C4.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

419C8F69C7334B6C811D655D93DAC1C9.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

5DCC2223797948F286CB06B030003072.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

5049F570164A4E38BBD39A0B9C2F6D5B.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

5674C6E206DB431F841398C9D16AA41F.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

1C45DF107C7A462693CBBA43E361BB2A.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

3B4C4D3923744F40815AEC725BE757D9.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

2C8A6C750CC7422B9A4EA0C4D484DD2E.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

E6319AE80FEA4BEEA6D8B9EF429D9F15.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

62C4A04C0948469CA093BF44789C45A8.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

A20E5A5C2ECB45D290A90E952E9836B8.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

03FD14563500419C91AF94F3D6937D0A.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

5CB5F01DDAA54C3BA411CA00CB630ECD.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

47B25022A33B49B1A5126F87759670E5.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

0F368081FF504551B8A60FC653E7CD3D.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

DAEC9CF2E24247BEBB213492D44DF555.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

81893D7776F34110A582F0888B4ADD56.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

C0C67D7C1D014B65967470045471A245.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

9452C7A318BE439E9E9D74EAC36B5B3A.description: Demonstrate a proficient knowledge of autobody by including a written self-assessment.

A5F25C0F4A014140B39A64E8B54C17AF.description: Present an advanced project to display the advancement of skills from previous projects.

775E4EC2A509465C8511C768CEBEC7BC.description: Develop an advanced project utilizing guideline outlined in Module 32.

00B280BB5B22450DB513E1E2B57C374A.description: Design, carry out and present an advanced project with self-assessment.

70AE947900CC44E49A28B618802CF323.description: Explore reasons refinish colours may not match the original automobile colour.

3AFFE1383D364AD98B1EBB37EBFFD0BB.description: Discuss own and peer’s colour matching to provide feedback on the strengths and areas for improvement.

FB21BF44AACD45C39567695456E996CD.description: Perform a colour tinting to obtain a blendable match for a test panel.

7938648B66D84B53A7A6B31B3FD7ED50.description: Describe and apply mixing variants to colour match original factory paint.

81651F587DEF452CA03C7AEC58D35E5C.description: Compare metallic, pearlescent and tri-coat types of paint.

5F64AFE8DCF847D2A5EBEF2B12532E5C.description: Research the basic concepts of colour theory and how different lighting affects colour perception.

F9F89EC31CCE494FB92B61243167D1F5.description: Apply principles of colour theory and tinting to correct common paint problems.

40A8AB64255D4C3A94D77F8AB1CFB885.description: Examine upcoming technologies, trends and processes (e.g., bonding, welding, finishing) in the autobody trade.

030F943BB1C44B7BA20182C5DCF452B1.description: Research and estimate the cost of purchasing electrical testing equipment to enter the autobody trade.

8F83A7A952624DB696DB91F9871E1E30.description: Explore information technologies (e.g., databases, diagnostic software, estimating programs) used in the autobody industry.

8BF6365223D645FEA1CFEE0A47D0840C.description: Investigate the evolution of complex materials (e.g., high-strength steel, lightweight materials), construction (e.g., exterior crumples in a collision) and technologies (e.g., safety sensors) in automobile design and the impact on autobody repair.

F73743EE765041288F3BB3A5D63C9472.description: Analyze the use of complex materials, construction and technologies in automobile design.

E95AD42994C348DB9CF20EB622F4F9B2.description: Explore information technologies (e.g., databases, diagnostic software) used in the autobody industry.

D9746FC481EA41FCA6FFCF8FB2D13E6B.description: Perform correct safety procedures and the appropriate use of hand and power tools to disconnect and reconnect sensors.

E7D217E77CCF4590934CAA04CF704335.description: Investigate basic diagnostic issues and research the range of corrective work procedures to repair electrical and electronic system failures in automobiles.

89C5C653DF254A618EFE9CBE33E70BDB.description: Examine an automobile to identify which sensors have to be disconnected, tested and reconnected during a repair process.

D9AF6A516DCE4FFBA1768265B6A739C5.description: Identify and repair automotive wiring, electrical and electronic components and computer components related to collision repair.

68AEA88D56DC461CA23AE370F9A52769.description: Describe the characteristics of automotive storage batteries and their relationship to the electrical components of an automobile.

9A93AF79536644EEB95719080F224E2B.description: Explain electron theory, Ohm’s Law and automotive circuits in automobile electrical and electronic systems.

99FBEE3938FD47319A21E3865707E98B.description: Research the history and evolution of electrical and electronic systems in automobile design including major changes and characteristics of selected components.

57641313AC6E42AA8F87DB4ED3C887CF.description: Examine the evolution and characteristics of electrical and electronic systems in automobile design.

9D369646B6B34963844580E844A5CC06.description: Introduction to Automobile Electrical and Electronic Systems (Optional)

7BAE8C6045A342C1B8521ADE6EBE662D.description: Examine collision repair and refinishing technology’s sustainability practices and impact on the environment.

512E2366A6214A0482916E808F8F32F8.description: Describe effects of collision repair and refinishing technology on human health and well-being, including tradespersons working in the field and those who use their services.

1C4A731D148A4ECE841763D7EA72AA27.description: Practise proper safety procedures following WHMIS 2015 specifications.

7CDF2D2728AB433690FB456205ED8226.description: Practise correct safety procedures such as wearing overalls and safety goggles and using a respirator.

6F192B856DD248858E427EDDB3FF703C.description: Identify steps required to prepare an automobile for painting including: selecting the appropriate products according to original equipment manufacturer (OEM) specifications; describing the uses of primer and paint and identifying the pot life of paint or primer; adjusting primer to the correct viscosity for spraying and determining the appropriate amount of hardener to add to the primer; choosing the type of solvent appropriate for the temperature in the shop and adjusting the amount as needed; and, examining the automobile to identify imperfections in the finished paint job and carrying out appropriate corrective action.

2BF3ADD3A5044D53AC23C006A224C5FD.description: Select appropriate tools, such as a spray gun, and appropriate techniques to perform basic surface preparation.

FAD07632CE12469BB5168BB5E3A0D52E.description: Prepare a cost estimate of the materials required to refinish and repaint an automobile.

15F0F97BC6A540D8A2D49DC4F7B2E905.description: Examine the cause of corrosion damage and select the appropriate products and original equipment manufacturer (OEM) procedures to protect against corrosion.

1E62DEEBB2C44A00856BD46B95B4E0C8.description: Assess complex corrosion damage to refinish and repaint part of an automobile.

48B8A6B30A844FC8879FEAEA81E09761.description: Examine the properties of dissimilar automotive materials (e.g., carbon, fibre, plastic, stainless).

6A49A2F988D44B5BAD4759A5E90CA108.description: Describe proper safety procedures used by certified technicians to disable an automobile air bag sensor system.

87EE5DA81E474393A818EFE0421C791A.description: Identify part numbers, prices, installation time and procedures using original equipment manufacturer (OEM) specifications and software and/or manuals.

A991AB4E2FDE469E964894C1D093CE8B.description: Describe the construction and safety features of plastic bumpers.

F8756E9CA926489E92DBAB5C0BF75A92.description: Identify front (e.g., cowl, shock towers, radiator and supports, fire wall, fenders, hood), centre (e.g., floor pan, pillars, rocker panel, rear shelf, doors, glass, hinges, side impact beam, roof panel, instrument panel, dash) and rear (e.g., trunk floor, trunk lid, quarter panel, lower rear panels, rear shock towers, inner wheel housing, upper body panel) section components of an automobile.

0B9B5932879D48339B626A6032BD027F.description: Research the history of automobile structural design including major changes and characteristics of selected components.

70BF526F704C4A82B5830C3663286A73.description: Examine the evolution and characteristics of structural components in each section of the automobile.

A7082BEFBCF341588F12F6ECF563DA84.description: Discuss the quality of own and peer’s repair to provide feedback on the strengths and areas for improvement.

F4DA88B45EB34E50A28F642EE4A7B521.description: Develop assessment criteria with peers to assess the quality of the repair.

40E27B2982064B1D9F861A0BFA669E5C.description: Perform spot repair and surface preparation for metal or plastic surfaces.

7E8AB1189A1D4763B20715E39F1A1807.description: Identify various types of plastic and choose compatible materials and tools.

B560EA41EA534B07B690F79F225F1A81.description: Identify types of material and choose appropriate products and tools following original equipment manufacturer (OEM) specifications.

A133BB48E65D4AAEBD198FD3EB2A4505.description: Assess the damage and research and prepare an estimate of the cost to prepare surfaces for repair.

5916144284D7406E8E004E5AB2007A31.description: Research the range of corrective work procedures for surface preparation.

2FB2FF080B5349E1B215A87B0FF5B4B2.description: Assess damaged areas and carry out surface preparation.

DBC7CBE91FFE4C4787630F4FDEEEA94B.description: Ensure all PPE is cleaned appropriately.

17D918EDBEFA4491B6A3EC700F01583C.description: Identify the purpose and proper use and fit of personal protective equipment (PPE) required for welding, including eye protection (lens shades), clothing, hearing protection and footwear while identifying the hazards from which they protect individuals.

ED15887337D148A687F31D9076DE5B69.description: Perform and analyze a variety of specified welds, including plug weld, spot weld, butt weld and lap weld.

029D66BA843D46548B120412A5408F7E.description: Identify metals and perform preparation and assembly tasks prior to welding.

7AC4B41870F44A6A9CFFCD67C60403AD.description: Disassemble, clean and reassemble GMAW welder components.

2B1697CC446643ACBA042BCE7AE81073.description: Compare various types of wire and shielding gases used for GMAW.

EC32E402F3884730BEC7A26372B23F66.description: Explain the importance of employing correct start-up and shut-down procedures for GMAW equipment including checking and cleaning up the work station.

A54E397324A94B85B282BE4346BEBF04.description: Demonstrate knowledge of GMAW equipment such as nozzles, contact tips, liners, wire rolls, gauges and flow meters, amperage adjustment and voltage adjustment.

7AA45B21D425440D935E164718490222.description: Use gas metal art welding (GMAW) equipment to complete specified autobody welds.

B9186A3BE6E340739FAED7CDB0934D29.description: Implement a plan for a safe and healthy classroom and shop environment.

2BD9814B8BFF4C85B6EE87F88C13BEE6.description: Assess the ergonomic design of the work space and implement appropriate procedures to ensure safety.

C9B0CEC425A040C69FFE93761B647F1D.description: Apply safe and fair work practices, including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

E31CE956B2EF48ABB0735E2347710723.description: Explain the proper procedures to follow to report a workplace injury.

339E2F9C96584F55A8CBCDD2313A6389.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work acts or environments.

ED70FD4F0E864054BB81ED0F14533410.description: Disconnect batteries and other power sources prior to undertaking autobody repairs where appropriate.

19E3794CD461420E9EB47E980DC13ED9.description: Assess hazards and apply appropriate safety procedures when working in a confined space.

705497FC91044F96AE79730A71DBB871.description: Assess the fire plan for the work area, including components such as fire alarms, fire extinguishers, exits and procedures, and make recommendations for improvements.

3F0DB0EC298849F69C1C7AB8F1D68EC9.description: Identify, label, store and handle hazardous materials according to Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).

49BEF39C052144F39A729537ADA8FA65.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE), including dust masks, approved respirators, coveralls, chemical resistant gloves, eye and hearing protection and footwear.

E596AF6797AE4E87BB7A859F5539E30C.description: Apply injury prevention principles to ensure safe work performance in the autobody trade.
